business.headline: Excelsoft Technologies IPO listing today: Will the stock open higher or lower?The allotment of shares was completed on November 24, and with the kind of subscription numbers the company has posted, many retail investors are hoping for a firm opening on the exchanges.

Tata Motors may hike prices early next quarterChandra said Tata Motors currently holds 16–17 per cent share in the SUV segment, and the Sierra is expected to lift this to 20–25 per cent once fully ramped up.

India's November Russian oil imports set to hit 5-month high amid US tariffsIndia, the world's third-largest oil importer, has been the biggest buyer of discounted seaborne Russian crude after Russia was shunned by Western countries following its 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
Sensex closes 314 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 313.70 points to close at 84,587.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 74.70 points to end at 25,884.80.

Do new Labour Codes hit Narayana Murthy's 9-9-6 dreams?India's new Labour Codes cap workweeks at 48 hours, with flexibility on scheduling, overtime pay, and a mandatory day of rest. But as industry leaders like Narayana Murthy push for 72-hour weeks and L&T's SN Subrahmanyan praises 90-hour schedules, many are raising questions whether these reforms will hold ground in a culture where overwork is routine.

Waiting for your IPO to list? Here's how opening price on markets is decidedMost retail investors have little idea how the opening price for an IPO is decided. They often rely on grey market premium (GMP), hype, and subscription figures to guess the listing level, even though none of these factors directly set the price.

Do the new labour codes put full-time jobs at risk?Fixed-term jobs just got a major boost under the new labour codes. But does this new flexibility mean full-time roles are at risk, or will companies find a new balance altogether?

India–US trade deal looks quiet. The 'energy' shift tells another storyIndia and the US may look stalled on a formal trade deal, but shifting oil flows, a major LPG pact and calibrated tariff moves show the real progress is happening quietly behind the scenes.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 16.48 points to 84,884.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.55 points to 25,954.95 as of 9:28 am.

Sudeep Pharma IPO closes today: Is it worth a bid? Check the GMPThe Rs 895-crore IPO includes a fresh issue of Rs 95 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 800 crore. The price band is set at Rs 563 to Rs 593 per share, and the minimum investment for retail buyers is Rs 14,825.
Apple layoff: Tech giant cuts jobs across sales team, says reportApple said it is reducing roles across its sales teams as part of a plan to improve how it engages with customers.
Sensex closes 331 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; BEL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 331.21 points to close at 84,900.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 108.65 points to end at 25,959.50.

GST 2.0 is lifting consumption. Can it lift Sensex and Nifty too?GST 2.0 has pushed prices down and demand up, but whether that momentum can lift Sensex and Nifty will depend on earnings, capex and global stability in the months ahead.

Tejas crash at Dubai Airshow isolated occurrence: Read HAL's full statementAn Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed in the United Arab Emirates on Friday while taking part in the Dubai Airshow 2025.

Who is Rama Raju Mantena, pharma king behind Udaipur's star-studded wedding?Rama Raju Mantena is a well-known name in the US pharmaceutical industry. Originally from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh, Mantena moved to the United States in the 1980s.
HAL share price falls 4% after Tejas fighter jet crash at Dubai AirshowThe HAL stock slipped to around Rs 4,430, down roughly 3.6% at 10:44 am. Earlier in the day, the stock had tumbled over 8%.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO allotment out: Did you get shares? Check listing detailsExcelsoft Technologies IPO allotment: Applicants who subscribed to the IPO can check their status through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Sensex, Nifty start week on a positive note as IT stocks lead the chargeBroader market indices were also in the green, mirroring the positive start. The tone was set by IT heavyweights: Tech Mahindra and Infosys jumped over 2% each, followed closely by gains in HCLTech and Wipro. Eicher Motors also featured among the early winners.

TCS suffers legal setback in US with $194 million penalty upheldThe matter has now been sent back to the Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division, which has been asked to review the injunction as per the directions of the Appeals Court.

Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

entertainment.headline: Mahavatar Narsimha in race for Oscar shortlist in animated feature film category Mahavatar Narsimha, directed by Ashwin Kumar, is among 35 animated films eligible for consideration in the animated feature category at the 98th Academy Awards. The shortlist will be announced on December 16, as the film meets all required eligibility criteria for Oscar qualification.

How To Make A Killing trailer: Glen Powell plots for billions in dark comedy thriller A new trailer for the film How To Make A Killing, directed by John Patton Ford and starring Glen Powell, introduces audiences to a high-stakes story of inheritance, betrayal, and murder within a wealthy family.

Dhanush-Kriti Sanon's Tere Ishk Mein gets UA certificate, obscene word replaced The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Aanand L Rai's 'Tere Ishk Mein' with a U/A 16+ certificate, requiring only a minor dialogue alteration, and confirmed its official runtime ahead of the film's global release.

Stranger Things 5: Season 4 ending explained and how it sets up Will's nightmare Stranger Things 5 is all set to release on Netflix, promising a thrilling conclusion to the intense battle that began in Season 4. The story delves deep into Vecna's sinister plans and Will Byers' pivotal role.

Netflix casts Toby Wallace as first lead in Assassin's Creed adaptation The Netflix adaptation of Assassin's Creed has cast Toby Wallace as its first series regular, marking the first major announcement for the live-action project.

Madelaine Petsch and Gavin Casalegno to star in Chasing Red film adaptation The upcoming film Chasing Red, starring Madelaine Petsch and Gavin Casalegno and based on the popular Wattpad webnovel, secures major international distribution ahead of release.

Wicked universe may grow bigger as Universal plans next steps Universal Pictures is considering expanding the Wicked franchise following the strong success of Wicked: For Good at the box office, with discussions underway for potential new film or television projects.

Rush Hour 4 back in development as Brett Ratner reboards franchise: Reports Paramount is developing a new Rush Hour sequel with Brett Ratner returning as director, after years of delays. The move reportedly follows Donald Trump's lobbying for the project, despite previous controversies surrounding Ratner. No official statements have been made by the director, the film's stars, or the studio about the sequel's progress.

Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana–Shehbaz fight injures Tanya as finale race intensifies The November 25 episode of Bigg Boss 19 turned intense after a heated clash between Farrhana and Shehbaz accidentally injured Tanya, just as wildcard contestants Malti and Shehbaz were cleared to join the Ticket to Finale race. With all housemates nominated, the competition has officially entered its most volatile phase ahead of the December 7 finale.

Shree Hanuman Chalisa becomes first Indian video to cross 5 billion views on YouTube 'Shree Hanuman Chalisa' has become the first Indian video to cross 5 billion views on YouTube, far ahead of all other Indian uploads. T-Series says the milestone reflects the devotion associated with the iconic devotional track featuring the late Gulshan Kumar.

Eva Green joins Wednesday Season 3 as Aunt Ophelia Eva Green has officially joined 'Wednesday' Season 3 as Aunt Ophelia, ending months of fan speculation after the mysterious character's Season 2 cliffhanger reveal. The new season will explore Ophelia's dark past, her psychic powers, and her chilling message: "Wednesday must die."

BB19: Nehal Chudasama shares video with evicted contestants, fans predict reunion Nehal Chudasama's latest Instagram clip featuring evicted 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants has triggered speculation of a possible reunion or special episode before the finale. Meanwhile, buzz around the 'Ticket to Finale' task continues as top contenders gear up for the final phase.

Varanasi makers share BTS video showing how Mahesh Babu's bull entry was created A new BTS video released by the makers of 'Varanasi' shows how Mahesh Babu's mechanical bull entry was planned and executed for the film's launch event. The clip highlights the technical preparation behind the viral moment and follows earlier first-look reveals of Prithviraj Sukumaran and Priyanka Chopra Jonas.

From Central Cee to Karan Aujla: Rolling Loud India mega-debut was long overdue 'Rolling Loud India' redefined festivals with 65,000 fans embracing global headliners like Central Cee and Wiz Khalifa, culminating in Karan Aujla's historic moment as the first Indian headliner, proving the country is a definitive force in world rap.

Dhurandhar's viral qawaali: SRK loves the song that has a Hrithik link. Read here Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has created massive buzz, especially for its trailer's qawwali-inspired ending that reimagines the iconic "Na Toh Karwaan Ki Talaash Hai." The song's deep-rooted musical history, spanning classical qawaali to 'Barsaat Ki Raat', has fans eagerly awaiting its official release.

Lupita Nyong'o was stereotyped in slave roles after Oscar win for 12 Years A Slave Despite her Oscar win, Lupita Nyong'o initially only received offers for stereotypical slave roles. It led her to consciously choose diverse projects and become a "joyful warrior for changing the paradigms of what it means to be African."

Dhurandhar's Ishq Jalakar – Karvaan: A pulsating reimagining of Roshan's classic The makers of upcoming film Dhurandhar have released the first song, Ishq Jalakar - Karvaan, ahead of schedule following enthusiastic response from audiences. The track, a reimagining of a classic, features Ranveer Singh.

The RajaSaab director shares shoot details, says Prabhas filmed in freezing cold Prabhas's 'The RajaSaab' is set for a major global release in January 2026. The makers recently emphasised how the actor braved extreme cold to film its musical sequences.

Very subjective: Rakul Preet Singh on Deepika Padukone's 8-hour working controversy Rakul Preet Singh has addressed the ongoing 8-hour shift debate in Bollywood, saying work hours should depend on an actor's stage of life and personal priorities. She stressed that there "can't be one rule for anybody" and cited examples from Amitabh Bachchan to 90s stars like Ajay Devgn and Akshay Kumar.

general news.headline: Self-evident fact: India jabs China's remarks on Arunachal after woman's detentionIndia has firmly protested against China after an Indian woman from Arunachal Pradesh was detained at Shanghai airport despite holding valid travel documents. New Delhi insists that Arunachal Pradesh is an integral part of India and demands an explanation from Beijing for violating international aviation norms.

Chennai got 220,000 H-1B visas: US economist alleges massive fraud in India's capThe former US Representative alleged that the H-1B system had been "captured by industrial-scale fraud", asserting that visa allocations from India had reached levels that defied statutory limits.

Why Bihar is taking back Patna's 10 Circular Road from Lalu Yadav's familyThe Bihar government has reclaimed the iconic 10 Circular Road bungalow from the Lalu Prasad family after nearly two decades, marking a significant shift in the state's political landscape. This move reflects the strengthened position of the BJP and changing power dynamics in Bihar.

2nd Test Day 5 Live: Can India avoid series whitewash?India (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score 2nd Test Day 5 Updates: India will resume Day 5 at 27/2, chasing an improbable 549 and staring at a potential series whitewash at home after South Africa dominated the first four days. With their first Test series win in India in 25 years within reach, the Proteas head into the final day as overwhelming favourites.

Pitbull attacks boy, bites off ear. This is exactly who should be punishedA neighbour's pitbull mauled a six-year-old boy grievously, detaching his ear, in Delhi. The pitbull is on the list of 24 dogs that the Centre had in March 2024 banned as pets. The ban has been stayed by the Karnataka High Court. But is banning breeds the answer to stopping attacks by pet dogs? Ultimately, who should be held responsible, and punished?

Outrage after Kali idol turned into Mother Mary at Mumbai temple; priest arrestedAn idol of Goddess Kali at a Mumbai temple was dressed to resemble Mother Mary. The priest has been arrested and a case under the charge of hurting religious sentiments has been registered.
Not clicked at comedy club: Kunal Kamra stirs fresh row with T-shirt mocking RSSComedian Kunal Kamra posts a photo allegedly mocking the RSS, drawing sharp criticism from BJP and Shiv Sena leaders.

Report claims Trump may fire Kash Patel as FBI chief, White House respondsMS NOW reports Trump is considering removing FBI Director Kash Patel amid growing frustration over controversies and may tap Andrew Bailey as successor. The White House denies the story as completely made up.

CCTV shows car ramming ex-Shiv Sena MLA while she was walking on roadA former Shiv Sena MLA, Nirmala Gavit, was critically injured after being hit by a car while walking with her grandson in Nashik. The incident, captured on CCTV, has sparked outrage and raised serious questions about the missing driver and police action.

Cyclone Senyar: Low pressure area intensifies, rain alert in Tamil Nadu, KeralaThe IMD said a depression over the Strait of Malacca and a low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal will influence rainfall across southern and eastern regions. Heavy to very heavy rain is expected through the week. Thunderstorms with gusty winds are likely in multiple states.

Fake degrees, political pressure: US diplomat exposes fraud in H-1B visa programmeIndian-American diplomat Mahvash Siddiqui has alleged rampant fraud in the H-1B visa system, claiming 80–90% of applications from India were fake. She says that during her tenure at the US Consulate in Chennai (2005–2007), officials repeatedly flagged the issue to Washington, but political pressure prevented any action.

Delhi's first-ever hot air balloon rides to begin from Nov 29, see pics of trialThe initiative is part of DDA's push to expand recreational and adventure options in Delhi, with additional launch sites planned at Asita, the Yamuna Sports Complex and the CWG Village Sports Complex.

Stranger Things 5: Season 4 ending explained and how it sets up Will's nightmareStranger Things 5 is all set to release on Netflix, promising a thrilling conclusion to the intense battle that began in Season 4. The story delves deep into Vecna's sinister plans and Will Byers' pivotal role.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Wanted India to grovel: South Africa coach makes controversial remark in GuwahatiIND vs SA: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad sparked outrage in Guwahati after declaring he wanted India to "grovel", reigniting a historically loaded and provocative term in the wake of his side's dominant display on Day 4 of the second Test.
Could 2026 be a breakthrough year for anti-obesity treatments?The year 2026 will introduce groundbreaking anti-obesity medications with surgery-like results.

Screenshots suggesting Palaash Muchhal allegedly cheated on Smriti Mandhana go viralSmriti Mandhana and Palaash Muchhal's wedding was put on hold after a health scare. Soon after, alleged 'cheating' text screenshots surfaced. India Today cannot independently verify the authenticity of these screenshots and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Only a few disagreements left: Trump claims breakthrough in Ukraine peace talksDonald Trump says there are only a few unresolved issues in the Russia-Ukraine peace process and has sent envoy Steve Witkoff to Moscow while Army Secretary Dan Driscoll meets Ukrainian officials.

Delhi continues to battle toxic haze as air quality stays very poorDelhi and the neighbouring NCR region experienced a 13th straight day of hazardous air on Wednesday, with the city's AQI at 337 and the majority of pollution hotspots registering very poor levels.

No food, only toilet breaks: Arunachal woman recounts ordeal at Shanghai airportSpeaking exclusively to India Today TV, the woman, Prema Wangjom Thongdok, said that immigration officials at Shanghai's Pudong Airport had no written document to explain why they were holding her.

Wig, makeup, skirt: Italy man poses as dead mother for Rs 80 lakh pensionPolice later found the mother's mummified body in their home, with local authorities calling the case a tragic story marked by deception and isolation.

T20 World Cup 2026 schedule: Check venue, date for IND vs PAK matchThe ICC announced the full schedule and venues of the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. The headlining fixture that is India vs Pakistan is set to be played on February 15 in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

Pakistan Army denies Afghanistan's allegations of airstrikes killing 10 peopleThe allegations surfaced hours after a suicide attack targeted the headquarters of the Federal Constabulary in Peshawar on Monday, killing three personnel and injuring twelve others.

How Yashasvi can learn from Sachin Tendulkar's SCG masterclass to regain formIND vs SA: Yashasvi Jaiswal's issues against left-arm seamers have resurfaced, with Marco Jansen removing him three times in four innings in the ongoing Test series, firmly exposing a growing weakness.

Jennifer Aniston styles her boyfriend Jim Curtis' hair, fans can't stop watchingJennifer Aniston shared a charming video on Instagram styling her boyfriend Jim Curtis's hair using her LolaVie products, delighting fans with this rare glimpse into their relationship. The couple recently made their first official public appearance, confirming their romance to the public.

Mahavatar Narsimha in race for Oscar shortlist in animated feature film categoryMahavatar Narsimha, directed by Ashwin Kumar, is among 35 animated films eligible for consideration in the animated feature category at the 98th Academy Awards. The shortlist will be announced on December 16, as the film meets all required eligibility criteria for Oscar qualification.

sports.headline: Champions League: Chelsea thrash Barcelona, Leverkusen stun Manchester City Champions League: Defensive lapses cost Manchester City and Barcelona dearly as both teams slumped to notable losses on Tuesday, undoing promising starts and leaving both giants facing growing scrutiny in the league phase.

India (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score 2nd Test Day 5 Updates: India will resume Day 5 at 27/2, chasing an improbable 549 and staring at a potential series whitewash at home after South Africa dominated the first four days. Gambhir doing his job, but players need belief: Raina defends India coach IND vs SA: Suresh Raina has backed Gautam Gambhir at a time when results have placed the Indian coach firmly under the scanner. For Raina, the real fix lies with the players rediscovering belief and responsibility at the crease.

India must focus on batting well, not the target: Pujara's advice for Guwahati Test IND vs SA: Cheteshwar Pujara has urged India to shift their focus from the target and concentrate on batting properly in Guwahati. India have been left with the daunting task of attempting a chase of 549 to save the series
Bret Hart alleges sexual relationship between Shawn Michaels and Vince McMahon Bret Hart's allegation has once again put Shawn Michaels and Vince McMahon under an intense spotlight.

Pathum Nissanka's historic 98 keep Sri Lanka alive in tri-series with win vs Zimbabwe SL vs ZIM: Pathum Nissanka's unbeaten 98 not only powered Sri Lanka to a nine-wicket win over Zimbabwe but also saw him surpass Kusal Perera as the nation's all-time leading T20I run-scorer.

Trusting our defence will be key: Ravindra Jadeja hopes India save Guwahati Test IND vs SA, 2nd Test: In the press conference after the fourth day's play, Ravindra Jadeja said that India have a decent chance of drawing the second Test against South Africa if they manage to show effectiveness with their defensive game on Wednesday.

India vs Australia in Ahmedabad: Surya picks T20 World Cup finalists, sledges Rohit Suryakumar Yadav boldly named Australia as India's preferred T20 World Cup final opponents, even as Rohit Sharma stressed he simply wants India to reach the summit and come out on top against any team.

T20 World Cup 2026: Chinnaswamy dropped again, Bengaluru remains off hosting duties The M Chinnaswamy Stadium has once again been excluded from a major ICC event, with Bengaluru missing out on hosting duties for the T20 World Cup 2026. The omission comes months after the IPL 2025 stampede and follows similar venue changes during the Women's World Cup 2025.

Rohit Sharma named tournament ambassador for Men's T20 World Cup 2026Rohit Sharma has been named the tournament ambassador for the Men's T20 World Cup 2026. ICC chairman Jay Shah made the announcement at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, November 25, where the tournament schedule was also unveiled.

Want to see real fightback and determination from Indian batters: Parthiv PatelParthiv Patel has urged the Indian batters to show fight and discipline on the final day of the Guwahati Test, with the hosts needing 522 runs to avoid a 0-2 whitewash against South Africa. He stressed technique, resilience and smart decision-making on a turning pitch.

Watch: Anil Kumble's reaction to KL Rahul getting bowled by Simon Harmer in Guwahati goes viralAnil Kumble's reaction in the commentary box went viral after KL Rahul was bowled by Simon Harmer on Day 4 of the Guwahati Test. The former India captain criticised Rahul's technique as India slipped deeper into trouble and edged closer to another home whitewash.

Did Virat Kohli's brother slam Gambhir for Test dip? Happens when you boss aroundIND vs SA: Vikas Kohli's jibe has added to the pressure on Gautam Gambhir as India struggle in Guwahati. Questions around leadership are now unavoidable.

Sri Lanka vs Zimbabwe, T20I tri-series, Match 5: Highlights from RawalpindiSL vs ZIM, T20I tri-series, Match 5 Highlights: Zimbabwe have won the toss and opted to bat first. Sikandar Raza's men will join Pakistan in the final if they beat Sri Lanka on Tuesday.

Draw in Guwahati Test as good as a win: Ravindra JadejaIND vs SA: Ravindra Jadeja said that managing to draw the Guwahati Test would be as good as a win for India, who ended Day 4 at 27 for two while chasing 549. India are looking to avoid a series defeat, having already lost the Kolkata Test earlier.

Watch: Virat Kohli arrives in Mumbai ahead of South Africa ODI seriesVirat Kohli has arrived in Mumbai ahead of India's ODI series against South Africa, entering with confidence after an unbeaten 74 against Australia. With KL Rahul leading in Shubman Gill's absence, India hopes to bounce back following a disappointing Test run.

Early blows in 549 chase kill hopes of draw as India face another home whitewashIndia vs South Africa, 2nd Test: South Africa tightened their grip on the Guwahti encounter as India wilted in the field with both bat and ball. After setting a 549-run target, South Africa dismissed Indian openers KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal, leaving the hosts reeling at 27 for 2.

England should have handled Travis Head better: Stuart Broad explains howAshes 2025: Travis Head's blistering 123 off just 83 balls sealed a two-day win for Australia in Perth. Now, Stuart Broad has revealed the tactical errors that allowed the left-hander to run riot unchecked.

Test struggles not Gauti bhaiya's fault, he loves the Indian team: Suresh RainaIndia vs South Africa: Former India all-rounder Suresh Raina defended Gautam Gambhir, saying it's unfair to blame the head coach for batting failures in Test cricket. India are staring a 0-2 series defeat against South Africa in Guwahati.

Prithvi Shaw eyes IPL return, set to lead Maharashtra in Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophyPrithvi Shaw begins a fresh chapter with Maharashtra as he looks to revive his career in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. With the IPL auction approaching, a strong performance while leading the side in Gaikwad's absence could help him return to the league.

LSG sign ex-KKR support staff member as spin coach ahead of IPL 2026Lucknow Super Giants have roped in Carl Crowe as their new spin coach ahead of the upcoming IPL season. The Rishabh Pant-led side announced the arrival of the England-born coach on their social media platforms.

Mohammed Siraj suffers shoulder injury scare as India bowlers toil in GuwahatiMohammed Siraj suffered an injury scare during the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati, briefly leaving the field after landing awkwardly on his elbow while fielding on Day 4.

Can India chase 549 in Guwahati? Here's what Test history suggestsIND vs SA, 2nd Test: India face a daunting, world-record chase in the final innings to avoid losing the Test series at home. South Africa's commanding lead and disciplined batting have piled on the pressure, with no team ever having chased 400-plus in Asia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
